Content.Title: New International Pathway Missionaries
Content.BodyCopy:
Welcome to Pathway!

We would like to welcome you to the Pathway team and hope you have a great experience serving as Pathway Missionaries. There are some forms and training that are required to begin serving as Pathway Missionaries.

If you encounter any problems, don't hesitate to contact Sister Laura Andersen for assistance.

Sister Laura Andersen
andersenla@byui.edu
208-496-1830
M-F 8am-5pm

Step 1: Introduction

The Recommendation for Church-Service Missionary Form, will be filled by your local Stake President assigned to the Pathway Program and or your Area Seventy leader. You may access a copy of this in spanish by clicking here.

Completing the following form:

  1. Personnel Action Request (PAR) Form: This online form will allow us to input you into the BYU-Idaho system. Once it's submitted, please allow 2-3 business days for processing before proceeding to Step 2.
  2. Pathway Site Meeting/Location Address: This is extremely important information to the Pathway Program Office. You can get the details from your local CES or ecclesiastical leader. Once you receive the address, email it to Sister Laura Andersen at andersenla@byui.edu

Step 2: Username/Password Set Up

Once Step 1 is completed you will need wait to until you receive a BYU-Idaho number before generating a username and password. Once the number is issued, it will be emailed to you. (If you have a social security number, please proceed to setting up the username and password).

When you receive the BYU-Idaho number you can generate a username and password by going to www.byui.edu/username.

Step 3: FERPA Training

Once Steps 1 and 2 are complete, you will be emailed when you have access to the BYU-Idaho Privacy Tutorial (FERPA). To access this tutorial, please do the following:

  • Go to my.byui.edu.
  • Type in your username and password.
  • Click on "Employee" tab at top of personalized access page.
  • Click on "Privacy Training" at bottom of personalized access page.
  • Click on links located under "Training Materials" to view policies.
  • Click on "Take Test" when ready to take the test.

Once you submit the test, we will review your submission to ensure it was received and grant you access to the Initial Training Course and Mission Control.

Step 4: Initial Training Course and Mission Control

The Initial Training course has a series of steps you will complete that will help you better understand your role within the Pathway Program. Each step within the course exposes you to specific information about the program. You will learn about campus resources, I-Learn (our Learning Management System which houses online courses), student leadership in the classroom, the Learning Model, and more. With this training complete, you're ready for Mission Control.

Mission Control was set up to assist you with your ongoing work in the program. It contains information on recruitment, marketing, applications, registration, language proficiency testing, and other resources.
